comment.author: 21133841@N03
comment._content: What a lovely old pier.  Alas, I imagine it's a shadow of it's former self these days when they seem to be prone to bursting into flames at the drop of a hat!

comment.author: 30423736@N06
comment._content: Hi, Here's a photograph of the pier at Eastbourne. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/bluedonkey/86316465/] This photo was posted on our Flickr group www.flickr.com/groups/besidetheseaside/, which coincides with our exciting exhibition 'Beside the Seaside'.

comment.author: 8366733@N05
comment._content: Ah yes, one of my unscheduled appearances. The crowds were thin but I was not...sigh.

comment.author: 28739705@N02
comment._content: Hello, I really enjoyed this photo please consider adding it to the Sussex & Surrey Digital Artists Group!

comment.author: 49602360@N00
comment._content:
Well it hasn't changed much.
You like this Maxyn?

comment.author: 41179012@N08
comment._content: The boat in the top picture is a pleasure boat that went out to take tourists to see Beachy Head cliffs from the sea.  As far as I am aware, these trips still lauch from the same place, albeit with slightly more modern boats.

comment.author: 65461440@N06
comment._content: I think the Pleasure boats are still run by the Allchorn family and are still very popular. Our pier is always busy in the Summer months and has an arcade, Fish and Chip shop, Tea Rooms and restaurant. I think we're really lucky as a town to have such a fine example of a Victorian pier :)
